infos.name: kitchen
infos.desc:
You've entered a kitchen.

 You see [if c_0 is locked]a locked[else if c_0 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] fridge close by.[if c_0 is open and there is something in the c_0] The fridge contains [a list of things in the c_0]. Hmmm... what else, what else?[end if][if c_0 is open and the c_0 contains nothing] The fridge is empty! What a waste of a day![end if] You make out [if c_1 is locked]a locked[else if c_1 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] kitchen cupboard here.[if c_1 is open and there is something in the c_1] The kitchen cupboard contains [a list of things in the c_1]![end if][if c_1 is open and the c_1 contains nothing] What a letdown! The kitchen cupboard is empty![end if] You can see [if c_2 is locked]a locked[else if c_2 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] cutlery drawer.[if c_2 is open and there is something in the c_2] The cutlery drawer contains [a list of things in the c_2], so there's that.[end if][if c_2 is open and the c_2 contains nothing] What a letdown! The cutlery drawer is empty![end if] You can see [if c_3 is locked]a locked[else if c_3 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] trash can.[if c_3 is open and there is something in the c_3] The trash can contains [a list of things in the c_3].[end if][if c_3 is open and the c_3 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if] Look over there! a dishwasher.[if c_4 is open and there is something in the c_4] The dishwasher contains [a list of things in the c_4].[end if][if c_4 is open and the c_4 contains nothing] What a letdown! The dishwasher is empty![end if] You lean against the wall, inadvertently pressing a secret button. The wall opens up to reveal an oven.[if c_5 is open and there is something in the c_5] The oven contains [a list of things in the c_5]. Hmm. You always thought you'd be more excited to see an oven in a room.[end if][if c_5 is open and the c_5 contains nothing] The oven is empty, what a horrible day![end if] You see a dining table. [if there is something on the s_0]You see [a list of things on the s_0] on the dining table.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_0]But the thing hasn't got anything on it.[end if] If you haven't noticed it already, there seems to be something there by the wall, it's a counter. Why don't you take a picture of it, it'll last longer! [if there is something on the s_1]You see [a list of things on the s_1] on the counter.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_1]Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though.[end if] You make out a stove. What a coincidence, weren't you just thinking about a stove? [if there is something on the s_2]You see [a list of things on the s_2] on the stove.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_2]But there isn't a thing on it.[end if] You see a ladderback chair. [if there is something on the s_3]On the ladderback chair you can make out [a list of things on the s_3].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_3]However, the ladderback chair, like an empty ladderback chair, has nothing on it. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?[end if] You can see a dining chair. The dining chair is solid.[if there is something on the s_4] On the dining chair you see [a list of things on the s_4].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_4] But the thing is empty, unfortunately.[end if]

infos.name: fridge
infos.desc: The [noun] looks stuffy. [if open]It is open.[else if locked]It is locked.[otherwise]It is closed.[end if]

infos.name: kitchen cupboard
infos.desc: The [noun] looks solid. [if open]It is open.[else if locked]It is locked.[otherwise]It is closed.[end if]

infos.name: cutlery drawer
infos.desc: The [noun] looks hefty. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if locked]There is a lock on it and seems impossible to crack open.[otherwise]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[end if]

infos.name: trash can
infos.desc: The [noun] looks durable. [if open]It is open.[else if locked]It is locked.[otherwise]It is closed.[end if]

infos.name: dishwasher
infos.desc: The [noun] looks commanding. [if open]It is open.[else if locked]It is locked.[otherwise]It is closed.[end if]

infos.name: oven
infos.desc: The [noun] looks well-built. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if locked]There is a lock on it and seems impossible to open.[otherwise]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[end if]

infos.name: counter
infos.desc: The [noun] is an unstable piece of garbage.

infos.name: dirty whisk
infos.desc: The [noun] would seem to be well matched to everything else here

metadata.goal: Look for anything that is out of place and put it away in its proper location.

objective: Welcome to TextWorld! You find yourself in a messy house. Many things are not in their usual location. Let's clean up this place. After you'll have done, this little house is going to be spick and span! Look for anything that is out of place and put it away in its proper location.
